intro: Paepalanthus stegolepoides var. acutalis, commonly known as the sharp-leaved puya, is a striking plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, spiky inflorescence that resembles a pinecone. The plant features strap-like leaves that are often sharply pointed, giving it its common name. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, dry conditions. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental cultivation in specialized gardens.
